Positive.HER2 Overexpression: Strong; complete membrane staining; indicative of HER2 positivity.
Positive.High Tumor Cellularity: Densely packed cells; high nuclear-to-cytoplasmic ratio; scant stroma; 'blue' appearance from dense nuclear staining.
Positive.Mitotic Figures: Numerous in aggressive tumors; cells in division; high proliferation rate.
Positive.Necrosis: Dead cell areas; cell debris; lost tissue architecture; outpaced blood supply.
Positive.Pleomorphism: Variation in size and shape of cells and nuclei.
Positive.High Tumor-infiltrating Lymphocytes Leve: Inferred from H&E sections; small, round, darkly stained nuclei; scant cytoplasm.
Positive.Dense Clustering: Large, densely packed cellular areas on H&E; high nuclear to cytoplasmic ratio; minimal stroma.
Positive.Loss of E-Cadherin: Negative staining pattern; distinguishes lobular from ductal carcinoma.
Positive.GCDFP-15 Positive: Cytoplasmic granular staining; secreted protein indicating apocrine differentiation.
Positive.Nuclear Markers: High density of nuclei; ER, PR, Ki-67, p53 staining; Ki-67 shows high proliferation index.

Negative.HER2 Protein Regular: No membrane staining or <10% staining; partial membrane staining in >10% of cells.
Negative.Hormone Receptor Negative: No nuclear staining for ER/PR; consistent absence across cancer cells; uniform lack of staining.
Negative.ER Negative: No nuclear staining; antibodies against ER don't bind.
Negative.PR Negative: No nuclear staining; antibodies against PR don't bind.
Negative.K67 Proteins: Nuclear staining; marks cell proliferation; absent in non-proliferative cells.
Negative.DDR (DNA damage response) Effective: Lack/reduced expression; indicative of defective DNA repair; susceptibility to DDR inhibitors.
Negative.Blood Vessel Density: CD31 or CD34 positive staining; lines blood vessels; increased density indicates active angiogenesis.
Negative.Increased EMT (epithelial-mesenchymal tr: Increased expression; suggestive of metastasis facilitation.
Negative.Vimentin Positive: Cytoplasmic staining; mesenchymal cell cytoskeletal component.

Equivocal.IHC Score 2+: No staining; faint staining; <10% tumor cells
Equivocal.HER2 Low Expression: Faint staining; barely perceptible; >10% tumor cells
Equivocal.HER2 Ultra-Low Expression: Weak to moderate staining; complete membrane; >10% tumor cells; Strong staining; complete membrane; <10% tumor cells
Equivocal.Heterogeneity: Variable HER2 expression; within the same tumor; challenging determination
Equivocal.Variable Staining Intensity: Variable intensity; across tumor areas; some regions stronger than others
Equivocal.Identified Invasive Tumor: Spread into tissues; potentially worse prognosis; beyond ducts/lobules
Equivocal.Moderate Tumor Proliferation: Lower than HER2-positive; higher than HER2-negative; complete but moderate membrane staining
Equivocal.Moderate Tumor Grading: Moderate uniformity; variable intensity and completeness; across tumor population
Equivocal.Metastatic Focus: Clusters of atypical cells; different from lymphoid cells; IHC markers highlight cancer cells
